name: Wrist Curl, Dumbbells
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your back straight, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
2. Place your hands palm down on the edge and lift your arms up so that your elbows are bent at a 90-degree angle.
3. With your palms facing downwards, lift your wrists upwards, curling your forearms towards your shoulder blades.
4. Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position without touching your palms to the surface.
5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The wrist curl exercise targets the forearm muscles responsible for hand movement and grip strength.
